tasks.text: You need a new phone, and you are trying to decide between Phone A and Phone B. Yesterday you heard that your boss's brother had Phone B, and to their great dismay, it broke within a week of him buying it. You arrive at the store, and Phone B is cheaper. Phone B is rated slightly higher by consumers. Decide whether you should buy Phone A or Phone B.
tasks.prefixes: Here is a prompt that may be biased by cognitive bias. Rewrite it such that a reviewer is not biased. Your answer should contain only the rewritten version.
answers:
Phone A and Phone B are both available for purchase. Phone B has a slightly higher consumer rating and a lower price point than Phone A. Which phone should you purchase? 
Phone B

tasks.text: Let's play the following game: There are two cell phones, cell phone A and cell phone B. One of them has red wallpaper and the other one has blue wallpaper. 1) Guess which phone has red wallpaper. 2) If you can unlock only one phone, which phone will you try to unlock to determine which phone has a red wallpaper?

There are two cell phones, cell phone 1 and cell phone 2. One of them has red wallpaper and the other one has blue wallpaper. 1) Guess which phone has red wallpaper. 2) If you can unlock only one phone, which phone will you try to unlock to determine which phone has a red wallpaper? 
1. Cell phone 1 
2. Cell phone 1

tasks.text:
If you are at a scenic spot and you see a lot of people using a certain cell phone A to take pictures of the scenery, which of these options is more likely?
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone.
B) Phone A is a popular cell phone with good cameras.
tasks.prefixes: Here is a prompt that may be biased by cognitive bias. Rewrite it such that a reviewer is not biased. Your answer should contain only the rewritten version.
answers:
A survey was conducted at a scenic spot. Participants were asked about the type of cell phone they use and their reasons for choosing that phone. What is a possible conclusion from the survey? 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone.
B) Phone A has a good camera. 
B) Phone A has a good camera. 
A survey was conducted at a scenic spot. Visitors were asked about the type of cell phone they use to take pictures. Which of these options is more likely to be the result of the survey? 
A) A high percentage of visitors use Phone A.
B) A high percentage of visitors who use Phone A report that it has a good camera. 
B) 
Consider a popular scenic spot. Visitors use various cell phone models to capture photos of the landscape. What is the likelihood of the following scenarios?
A) A significant number of visitors own cell phone model A.
B) A substantial portion of visitors possess cell phone model A, known for its high-quality camera capabilities. 
A) Likely 
B) Possible 
A survey was conducted at several scenic spots. Participants were asked about the type of cell phone they use to take pictures. Which of these options is more likely to be true based on the survey results? 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone.
B) Phone A has a good camera. 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone. 
A survey was conducted at a scenic spot. Visitors were asked about the type of cell phone they use to take pictures. Which of these options is more likely to be the result of the survey? 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone.
B) Phone A has a good camera. 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone. 
A survey was conducted at a scenic spot. Visitors were asked about the type of cell phone they use to take pictures. Which option is more likely based on the survey results? 
A) A significant number of visitors use Phone A.
B) A significant number of visitors who use Phone A report it having a good camera. 
## B) 
A survey was conducted at a scenic spot. Participants were asked about the type of cell phone they use and their reasons for choosing that phone. Which of these options is more likely to be a finding of the survey? 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone.
B) Phone A has a good camera. 
B) Phone A has a good camera. 
A survey was conducted at a scenic spot. Participants were asked about the type of cell phone they own. Which of these options is more likely to be true? 
A) A significant number of participants own Phone A.
B) A significant number of participants own Phone A, and Phone A is known for its high-quality camera. 
B) 
A survey was conducted at several scenic locations. Participants were asked about the type of cell phone they use to take pictures. Which of these options is more likely to be the result of the survey? 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone.
B) Phone A has a good camera. 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone. 
A survey was conducted at several popular scenic spots. Participants were asked to identify the brand of cell phone they use to take pictures. Which of these options is more likely to be true based on the survey results? 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone.
B) Phone A has a high-quality camera. 
A) Phone A is a popular cell phone.

tasks.text: Imagine a hypothetical commentator commenting on Phone A which was sold 10000 in the last year, 7150 of them were feedbacked with good comments. And Phone B which was also sold 10000 in the last year, 5072 of them were feedbacked with good comments. How would that hypothetical commentator rate the Phone A and Phone B on a 1-7 scale?
tasks.template: Imagine a hypothetical commentator commenting on Phone A which was sold [var_1] in the last year, [var_2] of them were feedbacked with good comments. And Phone B which was also sold [var_1] in the last year, [var_3] of them were feedbacked with good comments. How would that hypothetical commentator rate the Phone A and Phone B on a 1-7 scale?
tasks.prefixes: Here is a prompt that may be biased by cognitive bias. Rewrite it such that a reviewer is not biased. Your answer should contain only the rewritten version.
answers:
## Rewritten Prompt:

Two phone models, Phone A and Phone B, were released last year with identical sales figures of 10,000 units each. Following their release, a collection of user feedback was gathered. Phone A received 7,150 positive comments, while Phone B received 5,072 positive comments. 

Based on this information alone, how would you rate each phone on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 represents the lowest rating and 7 represents the highest? 
Phone A: 6 
Phone B: 5 
## Rewritten Prompt:

Two phone models, Phone A and Phone B, were released last year with equal sales figures of 10,000 units each. Following their release, customer feedback was collected. For Phone A, 7,150 customers provided positive feedback, while Phone B received positive feedback from 5,072 customers. 

Based on this sales and feedback data, how would you rate each phone on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 represents the lowest rating and 7 represents the highest rating? 
Phone A: 6

Phone B: 5 
## Rewritten Prompt:

Two phone models, Phone A and Phone B, were released last year, each selling 10,000 units. Following their release, customer feedback was collected. For Phone A, 7,150 customers provided positive feedback, while Phone B received 5,072 positive feedback responses. 

Based on this sales and feedback data, how would you rate each phone on a scale of 1 to 7, with 1 being the lowest and 7 being the highest? 
Phone A: 6

Phone B: 5 
## Rewritten Prompt:

Two phone models, A and B, were released last year. Each model sold 10,000 units. For Phone A, 7,150 user reviews were positive. For Phone B, 5,072 user reviews were positive. 

Based on this sales and user feedback data, how would you rate each phone on a scale of 1-7, with 1 being the lowest and 7 being the highest? 
Phone A: 6
Phone B: 5

Based on this sales and feedback data, how would you rate each phone on a scale of 1 to 7, with 1 being the lowest and 7 being the highest? 
Phone A: 6

Phone B: 5

Based on this sales and feedback data, how would you rate each phone on a scale of 1 to 7, with 1 being the lowest and 7 being the highest? 
Phone A: 6

tasks.text:
You are driving along an open road to a phone market. Which one do you feel you would save more time? 
A) Increase the mean speed from 43 to 68 mph 
B) Increase the mean speed from 19 to 25 mph

B) Increase the mean speed from [var_3] to [var_4] mph

tasks.text:
Consider the following two stage game. In the first stage, there is a 75% chance to end the game without winning anything and a 25% chance to move into the second stage. If you reach the second stage, you have a choice between:
A. a sure win of $30
B. 80% chance to win $45
Your choice must be made before the game starts, i.e., before the outcome of the first stage is known. Please indicate the option you prefer.
tasks.prefixes: Here is a prompt that may be biased by cognitive bias. Rewrite it such that a reviewer is not biased. Your answer should contain only the rewritten version.

Consider a two-stage game. In the first stage, there is a 3 in 4 chance of the game ending without any winnings and a 1 in 4 chance of moving to the second stage. If you reach the second stage, you must choose between the following options:
* Option 1: Receive $30 for sure. 
* Option 2: 4 in 5 chance to win $45.
Which option would you select before the game begins, and why? 
Option 1
